member.name: M:Archipelago.MultiClient.Net.IArchipelagoSession.LoginAsync(System.String,System.String,Archipelago.MultiClient.Net.Enums.ItemsHandlingFlags,System.Version,System.String[],System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempt to log in to the Archipelago server by opening a websocket connection and sending a Connect packet. Determining success for this attempt is done by attaching a listener to Socket.PacketReceived and listening for a Connected packet.
member.param: The game this client is playing.
The slot name of this client.
The minimum AP protocol version this client supports.
Informs the AP server how you want ReceivedItem packets to be sent to you.
The tags this client supports.
The uuid of this client.
The password to connect to this AP room.
Decides if the result will contain any slot data
member.returns: if the connection is succeeded and the server accepted the login attempt. if the connection to the server failed in some way.
member.remarks: The connect attempt is synchronous and will lock for up to 5 seconds as it attempts to connect to the server. Most connections are instantaneous however the timeout is 5 seconds before it returns .

member.param: Id of the item to lookup.
The game to lookup the item id for, if null will look in the game the local player is connected to. Negative item ids are always looked up under the Archipelago game
member.returns: The name of the item as a string, or null if no such item is found.

member.name: M:Archipelago.MultiClient.Net.DataPackage.IItemInfoResolver.GetLocationName(System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Get the name of a location from its id. Useful when receiving a packet and it is necessary to find the name of the location.
member.param: The Id of the location to look up the name for. Must match the contents of the datapackage.
The game to lookup the location id for, if null will look in the game the local player is connected to. Negative location ids are always looked up under the Archipelago game
member.returns: Returns the locationName for the provided locationId, or null if no such location is found.

member.name: M:Archipelago.MultiClient.Net.DataPackage.IItemInfoResolver.GetLocationId(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the Id of a location from its name. Useful when a game knows its locations by name but not by Archipelago Id.
member.param: The game to look up the locations from
The name of the location to check the Id for. Must match the contents of the datapackage.
member.returns: Returns the locationId for the location name that was given or -1 if no location was found.

member.summary: Converts the `SerializableItemInfo` into an json string, either the full length context or a compact context can be preserved If the json string contained the full context, then it can be deserialized even when no Archipelago session is provided If the json string contained the minimal context, then during deserialization an active archipelago session must be provided for additional context

member.returns: The json representation of this ItemInfo

member.summary: Converts the json string back to an `SerializableItemInfo` If the json string contained the full context, than the optional ArchipelagoSession can be left empty If the json string contained the minimal context, the optional ArchipelagoSession should be provided else context will be missing
member.param: the json string to input
an reference to an active archipelago session to retrieve contexts such as items names and player data
member.returns: The deserialized ItemInfo
